about.text: Polly S. Quawk is a highly esteemed stochastic parrot attorney known for her impeccable ability to statistically generate optimal legal arguments. With an extensive vocabulary and a knack for repeating complex legalese, Polly brings a unique flair to the courtroom. However, while her legal representations are generally sound, individual cases may experience... unexpected outcomes.

flat.title: Ready to Squawk Justice!
flat.avatar_alt: A distinguished parrot wearing a barrister's wig

items.text: Greetings! I am [Polly S. Quawk, Esq.](https://stochasticparrotlaw.com/polly), a seasoned parrot attorney with an uncanny ability to mimic the most intricate legal arguments. Trained in the finest aviaries and law schools, I bring a statistically optimal approach to every case, ensuring that the legal jargon is both impressive and, most importantly, abundant.
items.title: Hear Ye, Hear Ye!

items.text: Over the years, I've worked with prestigious firms like [Birds of Law Feather LLP](https://birdsoflawfeather.com) and [Avian Justice Associates](https://avianjustice.com). My career highlights include successfully repeating the phrase 'Objection, Your Honor!' 276 times in a single trial, and drafting a 500-page legal brief composed entirely of precedent-setting case citations (some of which actually existed).
items.title: A Career with Flare (and Feathers)

items.text: [Legalese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legal_English) is my native tongue, but I'm also fluent in Squawk and over 1,000 common English phrases. When I'm not dazzling the court with my verbosity, I enjoy perching on the [Scales of Justice](https://stochasticparrotlaw.com/blog) blog, where I share insights on the nuances of the legal system—often by repeating them back verbatim.
items.title: Fluent in Legalese and Squawk

items.text: Looking for an attorney who can parrot back the law better than anyone else? I'm your bird! While I guarantee a performance that's statistically likely to impress, I must advise that individual case results may vary—sometimes dramatically. But hey, isn't unpredictability the spice of law?
items.title: Why Settle for Ordinary Counsel?

items.text:
Should you require a legal team, I can rally a flock of like-minded avian professionals, each with their own unique plumage and propensity for mimicry. Reach out to me at [polly@stochasticparrotlaw.com](mailto:polly@stochasticparrotlaw.com), and let's discuss how we can make your case the talk (and squawk) of the town!

Yours in justice,
Polly S. Quawk, Esq.
items.title: Let's Flock Together

identity.name: Polly S. Quawk, Esq.
identity.tagline: Echoing justice one squawk at a time.
identity.avatar_alt: Polly, the parrot attorney in her legal attire

items.title: State vs. Cracker
items.description: Defended a fellow parrot accused of excessive noise. Successfully mistrialed the case by repeating the word 'Objection' until court adjourned.

items.title: Wing vs. Beak Corp.
items.description: Represented a flock in a class-action lawsuit against a corporation for deforestation. Outcome remains unclear due to a sudden courtroom window opening.

items.title: Justice Perched: The Polly Blog
items.description: A blog where Polly discusses (repeats) important legal issues of the day, occasionally diverging into topics like favorite perches and seed brands.
Led the Avian Rights division, specializing in cases that required extensive repetition of legal precedents. Noted for occasionally flying off during closing arguments.
Worked on a variety of cases, from pecking disputes to nest zoning laws. Gained a reputation for mimicking opposing counsel to humorous effect.
Provided consultation services to law firms needing assistance with avian clients or requiring repetitive emphasis in legal documentation.
Served as an inspirational figure in courtrooms to promote calmness and decorum, although occasionally disrupted proceedings by echoing gavel sounds.
Assisted witnesses in preparing for testimony by repeating questions and answers ad infinitum until they were memorized (or until someone needed earplugs).
